pullRequest.body:
This takes some of the most common `simp` lemmas for hom classes (e.g., `map_one`, `map_zero`, `map_add`, `map_mul`, etc.) and marks them with priority `low`. The motivation is that these lemmas, by necessity, have very weak discrimination tree keys, so they apply very widely. However, when they match but fail to apply (as in the `TCSynth.lean` test file; last entry), they force type class synthesis to traverse almost the entirety of the hom class hierarchy looking for a match. This is a significant expenditure, so avoiding it when necessary is useful.

This seems to give reasonable performance gains, and the fallout from the priority seems to be quite minimal. In particular, one can restore the old behavior locally just by adding the relevant lemmas to the list passed to `simp`, (e.g., `simp [map_zero]`). This is needed only very rarely across Mathlib.

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

nodes.body:
### PR summary [f74bfdd4bd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16679/commits/f74bfdd4bdb744a4ddc0ad73561cf1903fc86fc1)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/a698e1b3-1dbc-4528-9130-b98310584ef0) for commit 56ab4d1aac478d742a02f1edd5656de6a170c428.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/8132429b-1b82-4cb6-bd8a-dd889f8771a9/to/a698e1b3-1dbc-4528-9130-b98310584ef0) against commit dc471f0ec194c404894751fd56207a5c794932e5:
```diff
  Benchmark                                             Metric         Change
  ===========================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.Algebra.Homology.DerivedCategory.Ext.Basic   instructions   -26.2%
+ ~Mathlib.Topology.Connected.PathConnected             instructions   -16.0%
```

aesop -1.967%
simp -0.526%
TC -0.918%
lint instructions -2.046%
instructions -310B

seems like a pretty clear win, especially given that there were only ~20 places across Mathlib that needed changing, and in each case, all that is necessary is to increase the priority of the lemma by adding it to the list explicitly. Moreover, 3 of these places were actually improvements (e.g., we didn't need to call `abel` in two places).

Moreover, it reduces the number of instance heartbeats necessary in a test file. (from ~8400 down to 10)

:v: j-loreaux can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10803075672/job/29966326190)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10803075672/job/29966326490)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - perf: mark generic `simp` lemmas with low priority
